description: Grovemade Desk Shelf System — minimal landing page for a premium workspace product.
fullDescription: This landing page showcases a beautiful modular desk organizer made of natural wood — designed to improve both functionality and aesthetics.
I built it using clean HTML5, scoped CSS, and modular React components with Next.js. It works great on any device and feels smooth to scroll.
Highlights include responsive layout, elegant UI transitions, and visual focus on product materials and details.
features: Semantic HTML for accessibility and SEO
devComment: I recreated the Grovemade landing to practice premium UI work using Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. I focused on responsiveness, structure, and clean styling to capture the brand's minimal look.

fullDescription: A clean and responsive landing page, built with Next.js and Tailwind CSS, and deployed on Vercel.
This is a remake of an existing layout, created to sharpen my frontend skills and explore modern React structure.
It demonstrates component reuse, mobile-first design, and utility-based styling.
devComment: This was a fun practice project where I recreated a landing page layout. I focused on keeping the structure clean, using React components with Tailwind, and making it look great on mobile.

fullDescription: A polished and stylish landing page for a creative agency, built with Next.js and Tailwind CSS.
The layout adapts beautifully to all screen sizes and highlights visual storytelling.
Includes server-side rendering for fast load and better SEO.
features: Modern CSS Grid and Flexbox layouts
devComment: This project helped me sharpen my design sense and responsiveness skills. I focused on smooth layout flow and solid SEO structure with Next.js.

description: Latte Cafe — landing page with mobile nav
fullDescription: A cozy landing page for a café, built in Next.js and styled with Tailwind CSS.
It uses static data to render components and includes a smooth mobile menu with toggle animation.
Simple, clean, and mobile-friendly — just like a good coffee shop site should be.
features: Data mapping for dynamic content rendering
Component state management for menu toggle
Clean separation of data and presentation layers
devComment: This was a great exercise in combining simple data mapping and mobile UX. I learned a lot about managing small UI states and keeping everything tidy.

fullDescription: A detailed landing page built with TypeScript, Next.js, and Tailwind CSS, structured for scalability.
I used a modular project structure with dedicated folders for sections, shared components, and utility functions.
The focus was on keeping code maintainable and ready for real-world expansion.
features: Clean project structure with scalability focus
devComment: This was my first time fully organizing a project like a real-world team would. I focused on clear file structure and reusability — it made the whole project easier to scale and understand.

fullDescription: A high-end landing page for an architecture studio, built with Next.js and TypeScript.
It uses structured static content for team, process, and portfolio sections, and keeps the layout clean and scalable.
Ideal for exploring component reuse and scalable project organization.
devComment: This was one of my most structured projects — I tried to approach it like a full dev team would. Using TypeScript and component breakdowns really helped me level up my organizational skills.

fullDescription: My personal portfolio built with Next.js, featuring multi-language support, theme switching, and responsive layouts.
It’s fully optimized for accessibility, SEO, and user experience across devices and languages.
features: Accessible UI components with ARIA support
devComment: This site is my digital home. I built it to reflect everything I’ve learned — multi-language support, dynamic themes, clean accessibility. It’s always evolving as I grow as a developer.
